title: On generic bricks over tame algebras
authors: R. Bautista, E. P\'erez, L. Salmer\'on
abstract:
We prove that if ${\Lambda}$ is a tame finite-dimensional algebra over an
algebraically closed field and $G$ is a generic ${\Lambda}-$module, then $G$ is
a generic brick if and only if it determines a one-parameter family of bricks
with the same dimension. In particular, we obtain that ${\Lambda}$ admits a
generic brick if and only if ${\Lambda}$ is brick-continuous.
